identificationModule.briefTitle: A Real-world Study in Participants With Smoldering Multiple Myeloma
identificationModule.officialTitle: Smoldering Pathway Assessment Real-World Knowledge (SPARK) Study-Retrospective Observational, Non-interventional Chart Review Study in Smoldering Multiple Myeloma

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the real-world characteristics and outcomes of participants with smoldering multiple myeloma (SMM) overall and by high-risk and non-high-risk SMM according to (AQUILA study criteria \[NCT03301220\], Mayo 20-2-20 and international myeloma working group (IMWG) 2020 risk classification models), and to evaluate the risk of progressing of SMM to multiple myeloma (MM) and outcomes in participants after progressing to MM.

armGroups.label: Participants with Smoldering Multiple Myeloma (SMM)
armGroups.description: Participants diagnosed with SMM between 01 January 2016 and 31 December 2021 will be enrolled in this study. Only data available outside of clinical studies from participant medical records will be collected. The data collected per participant in this study is defined as data in medical charts from date of SMM diagnosis until 31 December 2023, death or lost to follow-up, whichever comes first.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Treatment Patterns: Number of Participants With Type of Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with type of treatment (example, autologous stem cell transplant \[ASCT\], chimeric antigen receptor \[CAR-T\], proteasome inhibitor \[PI\], and immunomodulatory drug \[iMID\]) will be reported in participants with smoldering multiple myeloma (SMM) overall and by high-risk and non-high-risk classifications.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Duration of treatment as defined from the date of first dose of SMM treatment until the last dose of SMM treatment by treatment type will be reported.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Treatment Patterns: Time to Best Response
primaryOutcomes.description: Time to best response is defined as the time interval from the date of first dose of SMM treatment until recorded best response, by treatment type.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Treatment Patterns: Overall Survival in Participants With SMM Overall and for High-risk and Non-high-risk Participants
primaryOutcomes.description: Overall survival is defined as the time interval from the date of SMM diagnosis until the date of last observation (that is, date of end of study for each participant) or death, whichever comes first.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time to Progression to Multiple Myeloma (MM) in Participants With High-risk SMM
primaryOutcomes.description: Time to progression to multiple myeloma (MM) is defined as the the time from the date of SMM diagnosis to the date of MM diagnosis, as defined by 60 percent plasma cells, light chains, and MRI lesions (SLiM) and/or calcium elevation, renal insufficiency, anemia, and bone lesions (CRAB) criteria.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Progression-free survival defined from the date of SMM diagnosis until date of MM diagnosis or death of any cause, whichever occurs first.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Observation Patterns for High-risk and Non-high-risk SMM Participants and Overall
primaryOutcomes.description: Observational patterns (example, frequency of visits and hospitalizations) will be reported for high-risk and non-high-risk SMM participants and overall.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Rates of Progression From SMM to MM for High and Non-high-risk Participants
primaryOutcomes.description: Rate of progression from SMM to MM for high and non-high-risk participants will be evaluated as per SliM and/or CRAB criteria.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Risk Factors of Progression From SMM to MM
primaryOutcomes.description: Potential risk factors/predictors for progression from SMM diagnosis to MM will be investigated, for high-risk participants and non-high-risk participants according to AQUILA study criteria (NCT03301220), Mayo 20-2-20 and international myeloma working group (IMWG) 2020 risk stratification models, example age at SMM diagnosis and eastern cooperative oncology group (ECOG) at SMM diagnosis.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Myeloma-related Organ Damage Who Progress From SMM to MM
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with outcomes of myeloma-related organ damage who progress from SMM to MM will be summarized overall and by high-risk and non-high-risk participants.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With High-risk and Non-high-risk SMM
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with high-risk and non-high-risk SMM will be reported.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Participant Characteristics With High-risk and Non-high-risk SMM
secondaryOutcomes.description: Participant characteristics with high-risk and non-high risk SMM (example, age at SMM and MM diagnosis, date of SMM and MM diagnosis, Sex at birth, ECOG, and country) will be reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Best Response for the First-Line Treatment for MM
secondaryOutcomes.description: Best Response on first-line MM therapy (stringent complete response \[sCR\], complete response \[CR\], and partial response \[PR\]) will be reported based on the IMWG response criteria.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to Best Response to MM Treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time to best response to MM treatment defined as the time interval from the date of first dose of MM treatment until recorded best response, by treatment type.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants with Type of MM Treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with type of MM treatment will be reported for participants whose SMM evolved to MM.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: Duration of treatment defined from the date of first dose for MM until the last dose of MM treatment, by type of treatment will be reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Overall Survival for Participants Whose SMM Evolved to MM
secondaryOutcomes.description: Overall survival is defined as the time interval from the date of SMM diagnosis until the date of last observation (that is, date of end of study for each participant) or death, whichever comes first.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: Disease progression related deaths will be reported. Disease progression related deaths defined as the time from the date of SMM diagnosis to the date of death due to disease progression (primary cause).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: Type, dose, and start/end date of relevant therapies received since SMM diagnosis will be reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with ADRs as recorded in participants' medical charts will be reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormalities in Clinical Laboratory Tests
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with abnormalities in clinical laboratory tests (only available hematology, chemistry, and bone marrow biopsy or aspirate results that are obtained as part of the participants' usual standard of care) will be reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Survival Status at End of Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants who were alive or dead at the end of the study will be reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data collection up to 1 year and 2 months

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Have a documented diagnosis of smoldering multiple myeloma (SMM). SMM is defined as: (a) Clonal bone marrow plasma cells (BMPCs) greater than or equal to (\>=) 10 percent (%) and/or serum M-protein \>= 3 grams per deciliter (g/dL) and/or urine M-protein \>= 500 milligram per 24 hours (mg/24hrs). (b) Absence of 60 % plasma cells, involved/uninvolved free light chain (FLC) ratio \>= 100 and involved FLC \>= 10, and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) lesions- calcium elevation, renal insufficiency, anemia, and bone lesions (SLiM-CRAB) criteria
* Informed consent obtained prior to retrospective data collection in accordance with local requirements, either an informed consent form (ICF) indicating that the participants signed a consent for data collection for this research and agrees to have their data collected and analyzed, with source data verification (SDV), or the country does accept the ICF waiver for such type of studies
* Data recorded in participants' medical charts from date of SMM diagnosis and at least one year after should be available in the participant's medical chart at the participating site. However, data from any participants who died within the first year or after the first year after the SMM diagnosis is eligible

Exclusion Criteria:

* Therapy for multiple myeloma (MM) initiated within 90 days of SMM diagnosis
* Date of SMM diagnosis is missing
* Have an MM-defining event at the stage of SMM diagnosis
* Participants who received an investigational treatment for SMM are not eligible. However, participants that received an investigational treatment only after evolution to MM (not during SMM observational period) are eligible
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The study population will include participants aged at least 18 years of age with documented diagnosis of smoldering multiple myeloma (SMM) between 01 January 2016 and 31 December 2021.

locations.facility: Centre Hospitalier Regional d'Orleans (CHRO) - Hopital La Source
